metadata.title: Bluebook Tables T9-T16 Comprehensive Analysis
metadata.description: Complete structured data for Bluebook tables covering legislative documents, geographical terms, judges/officials, months, institutional names, publishing terms, services, and subdivisions

T9_legislative_documents.description: Abbreviations for U.S. federal legislative documents
T9_legislative_documents.usage_context: Citations to bills, resolutions, reports, and other congressional materials

entries.gpt_prompt: Identify House Bills in citations and ensure they use the abbreviation 'H.R.' followed by a space and bill number
entries.notes: Numbered bills introduced in the House of Representatives

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify House Resolutions use 'H.R. Res.' abbreviation with proper spacing and periods
entries.notes: Simple resolutions passed by the House only

entries.gpt_prompt: Check that House Concurrent Resolutions use full abbreviation 'H.R. Con. Res.' with all periods and spaces
entries.notes: Concurrent resolutions requiring passage by both chambers

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure House Joint Resolutions use 'H.R.J. Res.' with period after 'J'
common_errors: H.R. J. Res. (extra space before J)

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify House Reports include 'No.' and follow format: Congress number-Report number
entries.notes: Committee reports accompanying legislation; format is [Congress]-[Number]

entries.gpt_prompt: Check House Documents use 'H.R. Doc. No.' abbreviation with Congress-Document number format
Ensure House Miscellaneous Documents include 'Misc.' in abbreviation
entries.notes: Historical designation for certain House documents

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Senate Bills use simple 'S.' abbreviation followed by space and bill number
entries.notes: Numbered bills introduced in the Senate

entries.gpt_prompt: Check Senate Resolutions use 'S. Res.' abbreviation
entries.notes: Simple resolutions passed by the Senate only

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure Senate Concurrent Resolutions use 'S. Con. Res.' with proper spacing
entries.notes: Concurrent resolutions requiring passage by both chambers

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Senate Joint Resolutions use 'S.J. Res.' (note: no space between S. and J.)
entries.notes: Joint resolutions requiring presidential signature; note 'J.' connects directly to 'S.'

entries.gpt_prompt: Check Senate Executive Resolutions use 'S. Exec. Res.' abbreviation
Verify Senate Reports include 'No.' and follow format: Congress number-Report number
Check Senate Documents use 'S. Doc. No.' abbreviation
Ensure Senate Executive Documents include 'Exec.' in abbreviation
Check Senate Treaty Documents use full word 'Treaty' (not abbreviated)
entries.notes: Documents containing treaty text; 'Treaty' is NOT abbreviated

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Committee Prints use 'Comm. Print' abbreviation
Ensure Congressional Record citations use 'Cong. Rec.' abbreviation
Check Congressional Research Service uses 'Cong. Rsch. Serv.' abbreviation
entries.notes: Research arm of Congress; note 'Rsch.' abbreviation

T10_geographical_terms.description: Abbreviations for geographical locations including U.S. states, cities, territories, and countries
T10_geographical_terms.usage_context: Citations to courts, publications, statutes, and administrative materials

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure Alabama is abbreviated as 'Ala.' with period
entries.notes: Use in case names, court names, statutes

entries.gpt_prompt: Alaska is NOT abbreviated in Bluebook citations
entries.notes: One of few states never abbreviated

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Arizona abbreviation is 'Ariz.' with period
Check Arkansas uses 'Ark.' abbreviation
Ensure California is abbreviated as 'Cal.' (not 'Calif.' except in California Law Review)
entries.notes: Use 'Cal.' generally; 'Calif.' only for California Law Review

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Colorado abbreviation is 'Colo.' with period
Check Connecticut uses 'Conn.' abbreviation with double 'n'
Ensure Delaware abbreviation is 'Del.' with period
Verify Florida abbreviation is 'Fla.' with period
Check Georgia uses short 'Ga.' abbreviation
Ensure Hawaii abbreviation is 'Haw.' with period
Idaho is NOT abbreviated in Bluebook citations
entries.notes: Never abbreviated to avoid confusion with 'id.' citation signal

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Illinois uses 'Ill.' with double 'l'
Check Indiana abbreviation is 'Ind.' with period
Iowa is NOT abbreviated in Bluebook citations
entries.notes: One of few states never abbreviated

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure Kansas abbreviation is 'Kan.' with period
Verify Kentucky abbreviation is short 'Ky.' with period
Check Louisiana uses short 'La.' abbreviation
Ensure Maine uses short 'Me.' abbreviation
Verify Maryland abbreviation is 'Md.' with period
Check Massachusetts uses 'Mass.' abbreviation
Ensure Michigan abbreviation is 'Mich.' with period
Verify Minnesota uses 'Minn.' with double 'n'
Check Mississippi uses 'Miss.' abbreviation
Ensure Missouri abbreviation is short 'Mo.' with period
Verify Montana abbreviation is 'Mont.' with period
Check Nebraska abbreviation is 'Neb.' with period
Ensure Nevada abbreviation is 'Nev.' with period
Verify New Hampshire uses 'N.H.' with periods after both letters
Check New Jersey uses 'N.J.' with periods after both letters
Ensure New Mexico uses 'N.M.' with periods after both letters
Verify New York uses 'N.Y.' with periods after both letters
entries.notes: Two-letter abbreviation with periods; also 'N.Y.C.' for New York City

entries.gpt_prompt: Check North Carolina uses 'N.C.' with periods after both letters
Ensure North Dakota uses 'N.D.' with periods after both letters
Ohio is NOT abbreviated in Bluebook citations
entries.notes: One of few states never abbreviated

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Oklahoma abbreviation is 'Okla.' with period
Check Oregon abbreviation is short 'Or.' with period
Ensure Pennsylvania abbreviation is short 'Pa.' with period
Verify Rhode Island uses 'R.I.' with periods after both letters
Check South Carolina uses 'S.C.' with periods after both letters
Ensure South Dakota uses 'S.D.' with periods after both letters
Verify Tennessee uses 'Tenn.' with double 'n'
Check Texas abbreviation is 'Tex.' with period
Utah is NOT abbreviated in Bluebook citations
entries.notes: One of few states never abbreviated

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure Vermont abbreviation is short 'Vt.' with period
Verify Virginia abbreviation is short 'Va.' with period
Check Washington abbreviation is 'Wash.' with period
Ensure West Virginia uses 'W. Va.' with space between W. and Va.
Verify Wisconsin abbreviation is 'Wis.' with period
Check Wyoming abbreviation is 'Wyo.' with period

categories.name: Cities
categories.note: Examples only; compose others by state abbreviation

entries.gpt_prompt: Check Baltimore city abbreviation is 'Balt.' in citations
Verify Boston abbreviation is 'Bos.' with period
Ensure Chicago abbreviation is 'Chi.' with period
Check Dallas abbreviation is 'Dall.' with double 'l'
Verify District of Columbia uses 'D.C.' abbreviation
Check Houston abbreviation is 'Hous.' with period
Ensure Los Angeles uses 'L.A.' abbreviation
Verify Miami abbreviation is 'Mia.' with period
Check New York City uses 'N.Y.C.' (distinct from 'N.Y.' state)
Ensure Philadelphia abbreviation is 'Phila.' with period
Verify Phoenix abbreviation is 'Phx.' with period
Check San Francisco uses 'S.F.' abbreviation

categories.name: T10.2 Australian States and Canadian Provinces
T10.3 Countries and Regions
categories.note: Partial listing provided - includes major countries and regions
categories.gpt_prompt: Check country abbreviations against T10.3; many countries are NOT abbreviated; ensure proper use of periods and spaces

T11_judges_officials.description: Abbreviations for judicial and governmental titles
T11_judges_officials.usage_context: Case names, opinions, legislative materials, and governmental documents

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Administrative Law Judge uses 'A.L.J.' with periods after each letter
Check Arbitrator abbreviation is 'Arb.' with period
Ensure Assembly members use 'Assemb.' abbreviation
Verify Attorney General uses 'Att'y Gen.' with apostrophe in 'Att'y'
Check Baron title uses simple 'B.' abbreviation
Ensure Chancellor uses simple 'C.' abbreviation
Verify Chief Baron uses 'C.B.' abbreviation
Check Chief Judge/Chief Justice uses 'C.J.' abbreviation
entries.notes: Used for both Chief Judge and Chief Justice

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure Commissioner uses 'Comm'r' with apostrophe, no period
entries.notes: Note double 'm' and apostrophe; no period at end

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify Delegate abbreviation is 'Del.' with period
Check Honorable uses 'Hon.' abbreviation
entries.notes: Used before names as courtesy title

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure Judge/Justice uses simple 'J.' abbreviation
entries.notes: Used for both Judge and Justice; placed after name

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify plural Judges/Justices uses 'JJ.' (double J)
Check Lord Justice uses 'L.J.' abbreviation (UK)
Ensure Magistrate uses 'Mag.' abbreviation
Verify Master of the Rolls uses 'M.R.' abbreviation (UK)
entries.notes: Presiding judge of UK Court of Appeal (Civil Division)

entries.gpt_prompt: Check Mediator abbreviation is 'Med.' with period
Ensure Referee uses 'Ref.' abbreviation
Verify Representative uses 'Rep.' abbreviation
Check Senator abbreviation is 'Sen.' with period
Ensure Vice Chancellor uses 'V.C.' abbreviation

T12_months.description: Abbreviations for months of the year
T12_months.usage_context: Dates in all citations, case names, and legal documents
T12_months.special_note: May, June, and July are never abbreviated

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify January is abbreviated as 'Jan.' with period
Check February abbreviation is 'Feb.' with period
Ensure March is abbreviated as 'Mar.' with period
Verify April abbreviation is 'Apr.' with period
May is NEVER abbreviated in Bluebook citations
June is NEVER abbreviated in Bluebook citations
July is NEVER abbreviated in Bluebook citations
Check August abbreviation is 'Aug.' with period
Ensure September is abbreviated as 'Sept.' (note: 4 letters plus period)
Verify October abbreviation is 'Oct.' with period
Check November abbreviation is 'Nov.' with period
Ensure December is abbreviated as 'Dec.' with period

T13_institutional_names.description: Abbreviations for institutional names in periodical titles
T13_institutional_names.note: These abbreviations are used within periodical titles; see T14 for full periodical abbreviations

entries.full_form: American Society of Composers, Authors & Publishers
California (when referring to California Law Review)
entries.notes: Special case: 'Calif.' only for California Law Review; otherwise use 'Cal.'

T13_institutional_names.gpt_prompt: Check institutional name abbreviations in periodical titles against T13; ensure consistency with established law review citation formats

T14_publishing_terms.description: Abbreviations for publishing and editorial terms
T14_publishing_terms.usage_context: Book citations, publisher information, and editorial descriptions

entries.gpt_prompt: Check abridged/abridgment uses 'abr.' abbreviation
Verify annotated uses 'ann.' abbreviation
Ensure anonymous uses 'anon.' abbreviation
Check circa (approximately) uses 'c.' abbreviation
Verify compiled/compilation uses 'comp.' abbreviation
Ensure copyright uses 'copy.' abbreviation (though © symbol often preferred)
Check draft uses 'drft.' abbreviation
Verify edition/editor uses 'ed.' abbreviation
Ensure manuscript uses 'ms.' abbreviation
Check mimeograph uses 'mimeo.' abbreviation
Verify new series uses 'n.s.' abbreviation
Ensure no date uses 'n.d.' abbreviation
Check no place uses 'n.p.' abbreviation
Verify no publisher uses 'n. pub.' abbreviation
Ensure offprint uses 'offprt.' abbreviation
Check old series uses 'o.s.' abbreviation
Verify permanent uses 'perm.' abbreviation
Ensure photoduplicated reprint uses 'photo. reprt.' abbreviation
Check printing uses 'prtg.' abbreviation
Verify replacement uses 'repl.' abbreviation
Ensure reprint uses 'reprt.' abbreviation
Check revised/revision uses 'rev.' abbreviation
Verify special uses 'spec.' abbreviation
Ensure temporary uses 'temp.' abbreviation
Check tentative uses 'tent.' abbreviation
Verify translation/translator uses 'trans.' abbreviation
Ensure unabridged uses 'unabr.' abbreviation
Check volume uses 'vol.' abbreviation
entries.notes: Also in T16; used for multi-volume works

T15_services.description: Abbreviations for looseleaf and bound legal services
T15_services.usage_context: Citations to commercial legal reporters and services

entries.service: Affirmative Action Compliance Manual for Federal Contractors

entries.full_citation_format: AIDS L. & Litig. Rep. (Univ. Pub. Group)

entries.service: American Federal Tax Reports, Second Series

T15_services.gpt_prompt: Check looseleaf service citations against T15; ensure proper abbreviation and publisher designation in parentheses

T16_subdivisions.description: Abbreviations for document parts and subdivisions

special_rules.spacing: No space between abbreviation and number/letter for: fig., n., hist. n., tbl.
special_rules.section_symbol: Use § for section(s); use §§ for plural

entries.gpt_prompt: Check amendment(s) uses 'amend.' abbreviation with space before number
Verify article(s) uses 'art.' abbreviation with space before number
Ensure book(s) uses 'bk.' abbreviation with space before number
Check chapter(s) uses 'ch.' abbreviation with space before number
Verify clause(s) uses 'cl.' abbreviation with space before number
Ensure column(s) uses 'col.' abbreviation with space before number
Check division(s) uses 'div.' abbreviation with space before number
Verify figure(s) uses 'fig.' abbreviation with NO space before number
entries.notes: SPECIAL: No space between 'fig.' and number

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure footnote(s) uses 'n.' abbreviation with NO space before number
entries.notes: SPECIAL: No space between 'n.' and number

entries.gpt_prompt: Check historical note(s) uses 'hist. n.' with NO space before number
entries.notes: SPECIAL: No space between 'hist. n.' and number

entries.gpt_prompt: Verify line(s) uses 'l.' abbreviation with space before number
Ensure number(s) uses 'no.' abbreviation (often capitalized as 'No.')
Check paragraph(s) uses 'para.' abbreviation with space before number
Verify part(s) uses 'pt.' abbreviation with space before number
Ensure section(s) uses § symbol (single) or §§ (plural); NEVER 'sec.'
entries.notes: CRITICAL: Always use § symbol, never abbreviate as 'sec.'; double §§ for plural

entries.gpt_prompt: Check series uses 'ser.' abbreviation
Verify subchapter(s) uses 'subch.' abbreviation
Ensure subclause(s) uses 'subcl.' abbreviation
Check subdivision(s) uses 'subdiv.' abbreviation
Verify subparagraph(s) uses 'subpara.' abbreviation
Ensure subsection(s) uses 'subsec.' abbreviation
Check subtitle(s) uses 'subt.' abbreviation
Verify table(s) uses 'tbl.' abbreviation with NO space before number
entries.notes: SPECIAL: No space between 'tbl.' and number

entries.gpt_prompt: Ensure title(s) uses 'tit.' abbreviation with space before number
entries.notes: Common in U.S. Code and state code citations

entries.gpt_prompt: Check volume(s) uses 'vol.' abbreviation with space before number
entries.notes: Also in T14; used for multi-volume works

general_principles: Always use periods after abbreviations unless specifically noted
Maintain consistent spacing as specified in tables
Context determines meaning for multi-use abbreviations (e.g., 'ed.' for edition vs. editor)
Never use postal codes (e.g., 'CA', 'NY') in legal citations
Some terms are never abbreviated (Alaska, Hawaii, Idaho, Iowa, Ohio, Utah, May, June, July)
citation_checking_workflow: 1. Identify the type of citation element (legislative doc, geographic term, etc.)
3. Verify exact abbreviation including punctuation and spacing
4. Check for context-specific rules (e.g., 'Calif.' only for California Law Review)
5. Validate against regex patterns for proper formatting
common_errors_to_avoid: Using postal codes instead of Bluebook abbreviations
Abbreviating terms that should not be abbreviated
Incorrect spacing (especially fig., n., hist. n., tbl.)
